page.title: 11Churches in Aust
page.content: Aust has two churches. Aust Church is at the west end of the village. It is situated on elevated ground with views of most of the village. Most of the Church dates from the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries. Gravestones surround the building and writing on a number over two hundered years old is still distinguishable. there is a communal grave where victims of ferry boat disasters are buried. The Church has a number of particularly interesting features including : a medieval Font; a nave containing fourteen corbel heads and a stone pulpit erected in the sixteenth century with symbols of the Evangelists. Towards the east end of the village is an Evangelical church.
